frameDefinitions: An Agent produces a Forgery, an entity that they intend to pass off as a particular (instance of)  a Standard.
An Entity is evaluated for whether or not it belongs to a particular Reference_category in a context where its category membership is doubtful.
A Cook applies heat to Food, where the Temperature_setting of the heat and Duration of application may be specified.
This frame describes food and meal preparation.
The Self_mover, a living being, moves under its own direction along a Path.
frameExamples: So who was it that <t>faked</t> the photo 'showing' Jane Fonda and John Kerry with the Vietcong?

It can be hard to get your money back after discovering you've bought a <t>bogus</t>
autograph for hundreds or thousands of dollars!
Caitlin <t>baked</t> some cookies from the pre-packaged dough.
She <t>walked</t> along the road for a while.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person that creates a Forgery with the intent of passing it off as (an instance of) the <fen>Standard</fen>.
The <fen>Forgery</fen> is the product that the <fen>Agent</fen> creates with the intent of passing it off as (an instance of) the <fen>Standard</fen>.
The <fen>Standard</fen> is the actually existing or imagined (kind of) thing that the <fen>Agent</fen> wants to pass the <fen>Forgery</fen> off as.
The time at which the forgery takes place.
The location in which the <fen>Agent</fen> makes a <fen>Forgery</fen>.
The <fen>Entity</fen> that is being evaluated in terms of whether it is an instance of the <fen>Reference_category</fen>.
The type relative to which the <fen>Entity</fen> is evaluated.
The <fen>Cook</fen> applies heat to the <fen>Food</fen>.
This role identifes the entity that  directly supplies heat to the <fen>Food</fen>.
<fen>Food</fen> is the entity to which heat is applied by the <fen>Cook</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Temperature_setting</fen> of the <fen>Heating_instrument</fen> for the <fen>Food</fen>.
The <fen>Container</fen> holds the <fen>Food</fen> to which heat is applied.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the heat application occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the heat application  occurs.
The <fen>Cook</fen>  prepares the <fen>Produced_food</fen>.
The <fen>Produced_food</fen> is the result of a <fen>Cook</fen>'s efforts.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the cooking creation occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the cooking creation occurs.
<fen>Self_mover</fen> is the living being which moves under its own power. Normally it is expressed as an external argument.

<fen>Source</fen> is used for any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion.
In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion.  With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
<fen>Path</fen> is used for any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen>.  This includes 'middle of path'' expressions.
<fen>Goal</fen> is used for any expression which tells where the <fen>Self_mover</fen> ends up as a result of the motion.

<fen>Area</fen> is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path.  Note that this role should not be used for cases when the same phrase could be used with the same meaning with a non-motion target, since these should be annotated with the <fen>Place</fen> FE.
The direction that the <fen>Self_mover</fen> heads in during the motion.
The time when the motion occurs.

The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which a defined motion takes place.  Any specified or implied  <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen> should designate a location contained with the <fen>Place</fen>.  This role can be differentiated from <fen>Area</fen> by the fact that the annotated phrase can be used in the same meaning with non-motion targets.
listRoleExamples: <fex>He</fex> even faked her signature.
<fex>The bomb found at the US Embassy in Berlin</fex> was fake.
<fex>Drew</fex> sauteed the garlic in butter.
Jim browned the roast <fex>in the oven</fex>.
Suzy usually steams <fex>the broccoli</fex>.
He baked the cookies <fex>at 350 degrees</fex> for 11 minutes.
Boil the potatoes <fex>in a medium-sized pan</fex>.
Jim roasted the chestnuts <fex>in the evening</fex>.
We baked the cake <fex>in the kitchen</fex>.
<fex>Drew</fex> cooked dinner for his friends.
Drew prepared <fex>dinner</fex> for his friends.
Drew baked an apple pie <fex>at six int he morning</fex>.
Drew prepared the soup <fex> in the kitchen</fex>.
<fex>Fred</fex> crawled the narrow passage.
The cat ran <fex>out of the house</fex>.
The scouts hiked <fex>through the desert</fex>.
The children skipped <fex>into the park</fex>.
The mouse scurried <fex>about</fex>.
You should walk <fex>south</fex> about a block .
The hitchhikers walked <fex>in the middle of the road</fex>.
